etymologies: early 17th century: from Latin, literally ‘row, chain’, from serere ‘join, connect’

definitions: a number of things, events, or people of a similar kind or related nature coming one after another

examples.text: the explosion was the latest in a series of accidents
he gave a series of lectures on modern art

shortDefinitions: several events, objects, or people of similar or related kind coming one after another

definitions: a set of books, maps, periodicals, or other documents published in a common format or under a common title

examples.text: the first four books in the Toybox Science series

shortDefinitions: set of books, periodicals, or other documents published in common format

definitions: a set of games played between two teams, or among any number of individual competitors
shortDefinitions: set of games played between two teams

definitions: a line of products, especially vehicles or machines, sharing features of design or assembly and marketed with a separate number from other lines

examples.text: early models of the 600D series incorporated a centrifugal oil filter
a series III SWB Land Rover

shortDefinitions: range of products sharing features of design or assembly

definitions: a set of stamps, banknotes, or coins issued at a particular time or having a common design or theme

examples.text: a series of five stamps issued today to mark the 14th World Orchid Conference

shortDefinitions: set of stamps, banknotes, or coins issued at particular time

definitions: a set of related television or radio programs, especially of a specified kind
shortDefinitions: set or sequence of related television or radio programmes

definitions: denoting electrical circuits or components arranged so that the current passes through each successively

examples.text: the series connection of the two coils

shortDefinitions: denoting electrical circuits or components arranged so that current passes through each successively

definitions: (in chronostratigraphy) a range of strata corresponding to an epoch in time, being a subdivision of a system and itself subdivided into stages
shortDefinitions: (in chronostratigraphy) range of strata corresponding to epoch in time

crossReferenceMarkers: Compare with period (sense 5 of the noun)
definitions: a set of elements with common properties or of compounds related in composition or structure

examples.text: the metals of the lanthanide series

shortDefinitions: set of elements with common properties or of compounds

definitions: a set of quantities constituting a progression or having the several values determined by a common relation.
shortDefinitions: set of quantities constituting progression or having several values determined by common relation

definitions: a group of speech sounds having at least one phonetic feature in common but distinguished in other respects
shortDefinitions: group of speech sounds having at least one phonetic feature in common but distinguished in other respects
